headline.main: Google’s Driverless Cars Run Into Problem: Cars With Drivers
headline.print_headline: Driverless Car’s Nemesis? Drivers

headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley Lawyer Takes Antitrust Fight to Europe

headline.main: India Replaces China as Next Big Frontier for U.S. Tech Companies
headline.print_headline: For Giants of Silicon Valley, India Is the Next Big Frontier

docs.abstract: American tech giants like Facebook, Google and Twitter are looking at India as most enticing growth opportunity, noting that it is fastest growing major economy in world and has more lenient Internet policies than China; Prime Min Narendra Modi's tour of Silicon Valley shows willingness of Indian government to become haven for Internet companies, as he seeks tech companies' help to make country global Internet powerhouse.
